meanings.definition: A narrow, steep-sided ridge or hill
meanings.sent1: The hikers climbed the hogbacks to reach the summit.
meanings.sent2: The hogbacks in the distance looked challenging to hike.
meanings.sent3: The sheep enjoyed playing hide and seek among the hogbacks.
meanings.sent4: The hogbacks stood tall like ancient guardians of the valley.
meanings.sent5: The hogbacks cast long shadows in the evening sun.

meanings.definition: A type of geological formation characterized by a sharp, steep ridge
meanings.sent1: The geologists studied the hogbacks to understand the earth's history.
meanings.sent2: The hogbacks were formed millions of years ago through geological processes.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the hogbacks were giant sleeping dragons.
meanings.sent4: The hogbacks jutted out of the landscape like jagged teeth.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the hogbacks took the photographer's breath away.

meanings.definition: A type of architectural feature resembling the spine of a hog
meanings.sent1: The old building had intricate hogbacks decorating its facade.
meanings.sent2: The hogbacks on the roof added a unique charm to the house.
meanings.sent3: The chef designed a cake with hogbacks made of frosting.
meanings.sent4: The fence was adorned with iron hogbacks that gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The garden statue had hogbacks that gave it a whimsical touch.
